citation.article-title: Basfia succiniciproducens gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Pasteurellaceae isolated from bovine rumen
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Basfia succiniciproducens sp. nov.
Basfia succiniciproducens (suc.ci.ni.ci.pro.du′cens. N.L. n. acidum succinicum succinic acid; L. part. adj. producens producing; N.L. part. adj. succiniciproducens succinic acid producing)
Grows on blood agar under facultatively anaerobic conditions at 37 °C.
Colonies are 0.1–0.5 mm in diameter, shiny and greyish after 24 h.
Produces succinic acid under anaerobic conditions in the presence of a substrate such as glucose.
Glucose is fermented without production of gas.

In conventional test tube assays, acid is produced from dextrin, maltose and d-fructose, whereas no acid is produced from adonitol, d-arabinose, cellobiose, dulcitol, myo-inositol, melezitose, d-sorbitol and d-salicin.
Acid production from melibiose and d-rhamnose is variable.
On the Vitek2 GN and NH cards the following results are obtained.

Positive reactions for α-arabinosidase, β-galactosidase, leucine arylamidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, β-galactopyranosidase, phosphorylcholine, d-mannitol, maltotriose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-mannose, d-malate, d-ribose, sucrose, trehalose, phosphatase and phenylphosphonate.

Negative reactions for adonitol, l-arabitol, Ala–Phe–Pro arylamidase, l-pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, γ-glutamyl transferase, glutamyl arylamidase, β-glucosidase, β-xylosidase, alanine arylamidase, l-proline arylamidase, lipase, palatinose, citrate, l-malate, urease, maltose, H2S, d-sorbitol, d-tagatose, d-xylose, malonate, l-lactate alkalinization, α-glucosidase, starch (glycogen), succinate alkalinization, N-acetyl-β-galactosaminidase, glycine arylamidase, arginine arylamidase, ornithine decarboxylase, lysine decarboxylase, l-histidine, β-glucuronidase, Glu–Gly–Arg arylamidase, l-lysine arylamidase, pyruvate and l-glutamine.
Variable reactions were observed with cellobiose, 5-keto-d-gluconate, α-galactosidase, coumarate and Ellman's reagent.
No toxicity towards lymphoid bovine and human cells or fish cells, and no RTX toxin genes observed.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 42.5 mol%.
Strains have been isolated from bovine rumen as part of the normal flora.
The type strain is JF4016T (=DSM 22022T =CCUG 57335T) isolated from the rumen of a Simmental cow in Switzerland.
